       Introduced by M. of A. CUSICK -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Health

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the public health law, in relation to establishing a
         prescription monitoring program

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Article 33 of the public health law is amended by adding a
    2  new title 5-A to read as follows:
    3                                  TITLE V-A
    4                       PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM
    5  SECTION 3355. SHORT TITLE.
    6          3356. DEFINITIONS.
    7          3357. ESTABLISHMENT OF A PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM.
    8          3358. ADVISORY BOARD.
    9          3359. REPORTING OF PRESCRIPTION MONITORING INFORMATION.
   10          3360. ACCESS TO THE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING INFORMATION;  CONFI-
   11                  DENTIALITY.
   12          3361. EDUCATION AND TREATMENT.
   13          3362. UNLAWFUL ACTS AND PENALTIES.
   14          3363. EVALUATION, DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING.
   15          3364. RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   16          3365. SEVERABILITY.
   17    S  3355.  SHORT TITLE. THIS ACT SHALL BE KNOWN AND MAY BE CITED AS THE
   18  "PRESCRIPTION MONITORING ACT".
   19    S 3356. DEFINITIONS. 1. "BOARD" MEANS THE ADVISORY  BOARD  ESTABLISHED
   20  UNDER SECTION THIRTY-THREE HUNDRED FIFTY-EIGHT OF THIS TITLE.
   21    2.  "DISPENSER"  MEANS A PERSON AUTHORIZED IN THIS STATE TO DISTRIBUTE
   22  TO THE ULTIMATE USER A SUBSTANCE MONITORED BY THE PRESCRIPTION  MONITOR-
   23  ING PROGRAM, BUT DOES NOT INCLUDE:
   24    (A)  A LICENSED HOSPITAL PHARMACY THAT DISTRIBUTES SUCH SUBSTANCES FOR
   25  THE  PURPOSES  OF  INPATIENT  HOSPITAL  CARE  OR   THE   DISPENSING   OF

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD08321-01-1

       A. 3807                             2

    1  PRESCRIPTIONS  FOR  CONTROLLED  SUBSTANCES AT THE TIME OF DISCHARGE FROM
    2  SUCH A FACILITY;
    3    (B)  A  LICENSED  NURSE  OR  MEDICATION  AIDE  WHO  ADMINISTERS SUCH A
    4  SUBSTANCE AT THE DIRECTION OF A LICENSED PHYSICIAN; OR
    5    (C)  A  WHOLESALE  DISTRIBUTOR  OF  A  SUBSTANCE  MONITORED   BY   THE
    6  PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM.
    7    3.  "PRESCRIBER"  MEANS A LICENSED HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONAL WITH PRES-
    8  CRIPTIVE AUTHORITY.
    9    4. "PRESCRIPTION MONITORING INFORMATION" MEANS  INFORMATION  SUBMITTED
   10  TO AND MAINTAINED BY THE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM.
   11    5. "PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM" MEANS A PROGRAM ESTABLISHED UNDER
   12  SECTION THIRTY-THREE HUNDRED FIFTY-SEVEN OF THIS TITLE.
   13    S  3357.  ESTABLISHMENT  OF  A PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM. 1. THE
   14  DEPARTMENT SHALL ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN, WITH THE  CONSULTATION  OF  THE
   15  BOARD,  AN  ELECTRONIC  SYSTEM  FOR  MONITORING THE FOLLOWING SUBSTANCES
   16  DISPENSED IN THE  STATE:  FEDERALLY  CONTROLLED  SUBSTANCES,  ADDITIONAL
   17  STATE  SPECIFIED  CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES, AND DRUGS OF CONCERN DOCUMENTED
   18  TO DEMONSTRATE A POTENTIAL FOR ABUSE, PARTICULARLY THOSE  IDENTIFIED  BY
   19  LAW ENFORCEMENT AND ADDICTION TREATMENT PROFESSIONALS.
   20    2. THE DEPARTMENT MAY CONTRACT WITH A VENDOR TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN
   21  THE  ELECTRONIC  MONITORING  SYSTEM  PURSUANT  TO  GUIDELINES  WHICH THE
   22  DEPARTMENT SHALL PROMULGATE.
   23    S 3358. ADVISORY BOARD. 1. THERE IS  HEREBY  ESTABLISHED  AN  ADVISORY
   24  BOARD  TO ASSIST THE DEPARTMENT IN CARRYING OUT THE DUTIES OF THIS ARTI-
   25  CLE. THE ADVISORY BOARD SHALL CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING MEMBERS:
   26    (A) A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE STATE BOARD OF MEDICINE, APPOINTED BY  THE
   27  BOARD.
   28    (B)  A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE STATE BOARD OF PHARMACY, APPOINTED BY THE
   29  BOARD.
   30    (C) A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE STATE BOARD OF DENTAL EXAMINERS, APPOINTED
   31  BY THE BOARD.
   32    (D) A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE STATE BOARD OF NURSING, APPOINTED  BY  THE
   33  BOARD.
   34    (E) THE ATTORNEY GENERAL OR HIS OR HER DESIGNEE.
   35    (F) A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE DEPARTMENT, APPOINTED BY THE COMMISSIONER.
   36    (G)  A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE NEW YORK STATE MEDICAL SOCIETY, APPOINTED
   37  BY THE SOCIETY.
   38    (H) A  REPRESENTATIVE  OF  THE  NEW  YORK  STATE  DENTAL  ASSOCIATION,
   39  APPOINTED BY THE ASSOCIATION.
   40    (I)  A  REPRESENTATIVE  OF THE NEW YORK STATE ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF
   41  POLICE, APPOINTED BY THE ASSOCIATION.
   42    (J) A REPRESENTATIVE OF RETAIL PHARMACY, APPOINTED  BY  THE  NEW  YORK
   43  STATE PHARMACISTS ASSOCIATION.
   44    2.  THE  DEPARTMENT  SHALL  SEEK AND THE BOARD SHALL PROVIDE INPUT AND
   45  ADVICE REGARDING THE DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATION OF THE  ELECTRONIC  MONI-
   46  TORING SYSTEM, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:
   47    (A) WHICH STATE CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES SHOULD BE MONITORED;
   48    (B)  WHICH  DRUGS  OF  CONCERN  DEMONSTRATE  A POTENTIAL FOR ABUSE AND
   49  SHOULD BE MONITORED;
   50    (C) DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF  EDUCATIONAL  COURSES  IDENTIFIED  IN
   51  SECTION THIRTY-THREE HUNDRED SIXTY-ONE OF THIS TITLE;
   52    (D)  PROPER  ANALYSIS  AND  INTERPRETATION  OF PRESCRIPTION MONITORING
   53  INFORMATION;
   54    (E) DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN EVALUATION COMPONENT; AND
   55    (F) POTENTIAL NOMINEES TO THE BOARD.

       A. 3807                             3

    1    S 3359. REPORTING OF  PRESCRIPTION  MONITORING  INFORMATION.  1.  EACH
    2  DISPENSER  AND  PRESCRIBER SHALL SUBMIT TO THE DEPARTMENT, BY ELECTRONIC
    3  MEANS, OR OTHER FORMAT SPECIFIED IN A WAIVER GRANTED BY THE  DEPARTMENT,
    4  INFORMATION SPECIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENT, INCLUDING:
    5    (A) A PATIENT IDENTIFIER,
    6    (B) THE DRUG PRESCRIBED OR DISPENSED,
    7    (C) THE DATE OF THE PRESCRIPTION OR DISPENSING,
    8    (D) THE QUANTITY PRESCRIBED OR DISPENSED,
    9    (E) THE PRESCRIBER, AND
   10    (F) THE DISPENSER.
   11    2. EACH DISPENSER AND PRESCRIBER SHALL SUBMIT THE REQUIRED INFORMATION
   12  AS FREQUENTLY AS SPECIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENT.
   13    3.  THE  DEPARTMENT MAY GRANT A WAIVER OF ELECTRONIC SUBMISSION TO ANY
   14  DISPENSER OR PRESCRIBER FOR GOOD CAUSE, INCLUDING FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, AS
   15  DETERMINED BY THE DEPARTMENT. THE WAIVER  SHALL  STATE  THE  FORMAT  AND
   16  FREQUENCY  WITH  WHICH  THE  DISPENSER  OR  PRESCRIBER  SHALL SUBMIT THE
   17  REQUIRED INFORMATION.
   18    S 3360. ACCESS TO THE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING  INFORMATION;  CONFIDEN-
   19  TIALITY.  1. EXCEPT AS INDICATED IN SUBDIVISIONS TWO, THREE, AND FOUR OF
   20  THIS SECTION,  PRESCRIPTION  MONITORING  INFORMATION  SUBMITTED  TO  THE
   21  DEPARTMENT  SHALL  BE  CONFIDENTIAL  AND  NOT  SUBJECT TO PUBLIC OR OPEN
   22  RECORDS LAWS.
   23    2. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL REVIEW THE  PRESCRIPTION  MONITORING  INFORMA-
   24  TION.    IF  THERE  IS REASONABLE CAUSE TO BELIEVE A VIOLATION OF LAW OR
   25  BREACH OF OCCUPATIONAL STANDARDS MAY HAVE OCCURRED, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL
   26  NOTIFY THE  APPROPRIATE  LAW  ENFORCEMENT  AND  OCCUPATIONAL  LICENSING,
   27  CERTIFICATION  OR  REGULATORY AGENCY OR ENTITY, AND PROVIDE PRESCRIPTION
   28  MONITORING INFORMATION REQUIRED FOR AN INVESTIGATION.
   29    3. THE DEPARTMENT MAY PROVIDE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING INFORMATION  FOR
   30  PUBLIC  RESEARCH, POLICY OR EDUCATION PURPOSES, TO THE EXTENT ALL INFOR-
   31  MATION REASONABLY LIKELY TO REVEAL THE PATIENT OR OTHER  PERSON  WHO  IS
   32  THE SUBJECT OF THE INFORMATION HAS BEEN REMOVED.
   33    4.  THE  FOLLOWING  PERSONS, AFTER SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE EDUCA-
   34  TIONAL COURSES IDENTIFIED IN SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF  SECTION  THIRTY-THREE
   35  HUNDRED  SIXTY-ONE OF THIS TITLE, MAY ACCESS THE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING
   36  INFORMATION IN THE SAME OR SIMILAR MANNER, AND FOR THE SAME  OR  SIMILAR
   37  PURPOSES, AS THOSE PERSONS ARE AUTHORIZED TO ACCESS SIMILAR CONFIDENTIAL
   38  INFORMATION UNDER FEDERAL AND STATE LAW AND REGULATION.
   39    (A) A CRIMINAL JUSTICE AGENCY WHICH ENFORCES THE LAWS OF THIS STATE OR
   40  THE UNITED STATES RELATING TO CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES AND WHICH HAS INITI-
   41  ATED AN ACTIVE INVESTIGATION INVOLVING A SPECIFIC VIOLATION OF LAW.
   42    (B)  A PRACTITIONER, AS DEFINED IN SECTION THIRTY-THREE HUNDRED TWO OF
   43  THIS ARTICLE, OR AN EMPLOYEE OF THE PRACTITIONER WHO IS ACTING ON BEHALF
   44  OF AND AT THE DIRECTION OF THE PRACTITIONER, WHO REQUESTS SUCH  INFORMA-
   45  TION  AND CERTIFIES THAT THE INFORMATION IS NECESSARY TO PROVIDE MEDICAL
   46  TREATMENT TO A CURRENT PATIENT.
   47    (C) A PHARMACIST, AS DEFINED IN SECTION THIRTY-THREE  HUNDRED  TWO  OF
   48  THIS  ARTICLE, OR A PHARMACY INTERN OR PHARMACY TECHNICIAN WHO IS ACTING
   49  ON BEHALF OF AND AT THE DIRECTION OF THE PHARMACIST, WHO  REQUESTS  SUCH
   50  INFORMATION AND CERTIFIES THAT THE REQUESTED INFORMATION WILL BE USED TO
   51  DISPENSE CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES TO A CURRENT PATIENT.
   52    (D)  A  PATIENT WHO IS IDENTIFIED IN THE RECORD UPON A WRITTEN REQUEST
   53  FOR THE PURPOSE OF VERIFYING THAT INFORMATION.
   54    5. A PERSON WHO HAS KNOWLEDGE BY VIRTUE OF HIS OR HER  OFFICE  OF  THE
   55  CONTROLLED  SUBSTANCES  PRESCRIBED TO OR OBTAINED BY A PARTICULAR PERSON
   56  SHALL DISCLOSE SUCH KNOWLEDGE TO A PHARMACY TO INFORM THE PHARMACY  THAT

       A. 3807                             4

    1  SUCH PERSON WHO PRESENTS OR HAS PRESENTED A PRESCRIPTION FOR ONE OR MORE
    2  CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES AT THE PHARMACY MAY HAVE ALSO OBTAINED ONE OR MORE
    3  CONTROLLED  SUBSTANCES AT ANOTHER PHARMACY WHERE THE CIRCUMSTANCES INDI-
    4  CATE  A  POSSIBILITY  OF  DRUG ABUSE OR DIVERSION, POTENTIAL HARM TO THE
    5  PERSON, OR SIMILAR GROUNDS UNDER REGULATIONS OF THE COMMISSIONER.
    6    6. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL BE IMMUNE FROM CIVIL  LIABILITY  ARISING  FROM
    7  INACCURACY  OF ANY OF THE INFORMATION SUBMITTED TO THE DEPARTMENT PURSU-
    8  ANT TO THIS TITLE.
    9    S 3361. EDUCATION AND TREATMENT. 1. THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SHALL, IN
   10  CONSULTATION WITH THE BOARD, IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING EDUCATION COURSES:
   11    (A) AN ORIENTATION COURSE  DURING  THE  IMPLEMENTATION  PHASE  OF  THE
   12  PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM.
   13    (B) A COURSE FOR PERSONS WHO ARE AUTHORIZED TO ACCESS THE PRESCRIPTION
   14  MONITORING  INFORMATION  BUT  WHO DID NOT PARTICIPATE IN THE ORIENTATION
   15  COURSE.
   16    (C) A COURSE FOR PERSONS WHO ARE AUTHORIZED TO ACCESS THE PRESCRIPTION
   17  MONITORING INFORMATION BUT WHO HAVE VIOLATED LAWS  OR  BREACHED  OCCUPA-
   18  TIONAL STANDARDS INVOLVING DISPENSING, PRESCRIBING AND USE OF SUBSTANCES
   19  MONITORED BY THE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM.
   20    (D) A CONTINUING EDUCATION COURSE FOR HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS DEVEL-
   21  OPED BY THE AMERICAN SOCIETY OF ADDICTION MEDICINE AND THE STATE MEDICAL
   22  SOCIETY  ON  PRESCRIBING  PRACTICES,  PHARMACOLOGY  AND  IDENTIFICATION,
   23  TREATMENT AND REFERRAL OF PATIENTS ADDICTED  TO  OR  ABUSING  SUBSTANCES
   24  MONITORED BY THE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM.
   25    WHEN  APPROPRIATE,  THE  DEPARTMENT,  IN  CONSULTATION WITH THE BOARD,
   26  SHALL DEVELOP THE CONTENT OF THE EDUCATION COURSES  DESCRIBED  IN  PARA-
   27  GRAPHS (A), (B) AND (C) OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   28    2.  THE  DEPARTMENT,  IN  CONSULTATION  WITH THE BOARD, SHALL STRONGLY
   29  RECOMMEND THE APPLICATION OF A COURSE TO INFORM THE  PUBLIC  ABOUT  USE,
   30  DIVERSION  AND  ABUSE  OF, AND ADDICTION TO, SUBSTANCES MONITORED BY THE
   31  PRESCRIPTION MONITORING PROGRAM.
   32    3. THE DEPARTMENT, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE BOARD, SHALL, WHEN  APPRO-
   33  PRIATE:
   34    (A) WORK WITH ASSOCIATIONS FOR IMPAIRED PROFESSIONALS TO ENSURE INTER-
   35  VENTION, TREATMENT AND ONGOING MONITORING AND FOLLOW-UP; AND
   36    (B)  ENSURE  THAT  INDIVIDUAL PATIENTS WHO ARE IDENTIFIED AND WHO HAVE
   37  BECOME ADDICTED TO SUBSTANCES MONITORED BY THE  PRESCRIPTION  MONITORING
   38  PROGRAM RECEIVE ADDICTION TREATMENT.
   39    S  3362. UNLAWFUL ACTS AND PENALTIES. 1. A DISPENSER OR PRESCRIBER WHO
   40  KNOWINGLY FAILS TO SUBMIT PRESCRIPTION  MONITORING  INFORMATION  TO  THE
   41  DEPARTMENT  AS  REQUIRED BY THIS TITLE SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A FINE OF ONE
   42  THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS.
   43    2. A PERSON AUTHORIZED TO  HAVE  PRESCRIPTION  MONITORING  INFORMATION
   44  PURSUANT  TO  THIS  TITLE  WHO  KNOWINGLY  DISCLOSES SUCH INFORMATION IN
   45  VIOLATION OF THIS TITLE SHALL BE SUBJECT  TO  A  FINE  OF  ONE  THOUSAND
   46  DOLLARS.
   47    3.  A  PERSON  AUTHORIZED  TO HAVE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING INFORMATION
   48  PURSUANT TO THIS TITLE WHO USES SUCH INFORMATION IN A MANNER  OR  FOR  A
   49  PURPOSE  IN  VIOLATION  OF THIS TITLE SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A FINE OF FIVE
   50  HUNDRED DOLLARS.
   51    S 3363. EVALUATION, DATA ANALYSIS AND  REPORTING.  1.  THE  DEPARTMENT
   52  SHALL,  IN  CONSULTATION  WITH THE BOARD, DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT AN EVALU-
   53  ATION COMPONENT TO IDENTIFY COST-BENEFITS OF THE PRESCRIPTION MONITORING
   54  PROGRAM, AND OTHER INFORMATION RELEVANT TO POLICY, RESEARCH  AND  EDUCA-
   55  TION  INVOLVING  SUBSTANCES  MONITORED  BY  THE  PRESCRIPTION MONITORING
   56  PROGRAM.

       A. 3807                             5

    1    2. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL REPORT TO THE LEGISLATURE ON A PERIODIC BASIS,
    2  NO LESS THAN ANNUALLY, ABOUT THE  COST-BENEFITS  AND  OTHER  INFORMATION
    3  NOTED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION.
    4    S  3364.  RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROMULGATE RULES
    5  AND REGULATIONS NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS TITLE.
    6    S 3365. SEVERABILITY. IF ANY PROVISION OF THIS  TITLE  OR  APPLICATION
    7  THEREOF  TO  ANY  PERSON OR CIRCUMSTANCE IS HELD INVALID, THE INVALIDITY
    8  SHALL NOT AFFECT OTHER PROVISIONS OR APPLICATIONS OF THE TITLE WHICH CAN
    9  BE GIVEN EFFECT WITHOUT THE INVALID PROVISIONS OR APPLICATIONS,  AND  TO
   10  THIS END THE PROVISIONS OF THIS TITLE ARE SEVERABLE.
   11    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   12  have become a law.
